info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 3:18PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Madera and northeastern Fresno Counties through 345 PM PDT... At 318 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Clovis, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fancher Creek, Hurley, Mountain Rest, Auberry and Shaver Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
